Pre-Game Insights: The West Indies will enter the T20 World Cup 2024 as one of the top contenders for the title.
The West Indies have the luxury of relying on their individual brilliance.
With immense power in their lineup, a strong performance from just two or three players can be enough to overcome even the toughest opponents.
They likely possess the best batting lineup in the tournament.
For Papua New Guinea (PNG), defeating the West Indies will require an extraordinary effort.
While upsets in T20 cricket are not uncommon, PNG appears to lack the quality necessary to challenge this formidable West Indies team, even if they play their best cricket.
Both teams are likely to prefer chasing in this game.
The weather in Guyana has been wet recently, with potential rain interruptions expected.
Captains will likely opt to chase to better manage any weather-related adjustments to the target.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wicket at Providence Stadium in Guyana is expected to be conducive to good cricket.
Both pacers and spinners will find some assistance from the pitch, while batters can score quickly once set, thanks to the fast outfield and short boundaries.
The weather forecast for the match day is not very promising, with a 70 percent chance of rain.
Humidity levels are expected to be around 80 percent, and the wind speed will be approximately 15 km/h.
Others: The West Indies Squad: Rovman Powell(c), Johnson Charles, Brandon King, Nicholas Pooran(w), Shimron Hetmyer, Sherfane Rutherford, Andre Russell, Akeal Hosein, Obed McCoy, Shamar Joseph, Alzarri Joseph, Gudakesh Motie, Shai Hope, Roston Chase, Romario Shepherd.

The Papua New Guinea Squad: Kushal Bhurtel, Sundeep Jora, Aasif Sheikh(w), Anil Sah, Rohit Paudel(c), Dipendra Singh Airee, Lalit Rajbanshi, Pratis GC, Kamal Singh Airee, Kushal Malla, Karan KC, Gulsan Jha, Sompal Kami, Sagar Dhakal.
